Burnout Syndrome, Activate | cmdr-nova@internet:~$
Burnout Syndrome, Activate

Author: @cmdr_nova@mkultra.monster

Published: 16 Sep 2024


It‚Äôs been a little while since I‚Äôve written anything relating personally, to myself. I‚Äôve spent a lot of blog posts giving my own opinion on current events, or unfortunate advancements in tech that facilitate mass theft, or rolling my face on the keyboard in my Backrooms obsession. I suppose maybe sometimes it‚Äôs harder to write about myself, and what and how I‚Äôm feeling about things, because I find it hard to actually want people to know me.

It‚Äôs been over a decade and a half since I really started ‚Ä¶ ‚Äúmaking things.‚Äù It‚Äôs been even longer since I dipped my toes into web development, and suddenly arrived at this point. It‚Äôs been just about as long that I‚Äôve been working jobs that put money toward bills, and ‚Ä¶ I find myself wanting more.

When I was in high school, I just wanted to be a web developer. And, in a way, or sense, I am. But it‚Äôs not my career.

It should be. I basically grew up with a keyboard in my hands. Why is this not my source of income?

Instead, I throw myself around in manual labor jobs and tell people what to do, and I pray every second for my weekend, or my time away from work. Time away, so I can do what I really want to do.

And it‚Äôs come to this point where, I look back at the time I spent in my early thirties where I kind of ‚Ä¶ was doing what I wanted to do. It just wasn‚Äôt making me any livable money. I wonder sometimes if I just didn‚Äôt try hard enough, or if I was almost there. I had a semi-popular album, and then catastrophe happened. I continue to write fiction, but at this point it‚Äôs mostly just a hobby. I run a store in Second Life, but it mainly only just barely pays for the Second Life subscription itself (even though, bringing in sales enough to do that for almost ten years within the virtual world is actually pretty impressive).

I look back at that, and wish I could try again, or do it again, but now.

I think I‚Äôve realized this part of myself will never be happy until I am doing the concept of this, again, and also making a livable wage from it. For the longest time I thought I was at the end, or I thought I was as good as dead, and then everything changed and I made a whole lot of progress in life ‚Ä¶ only to wish I could go back.

I‚Äôm not burned out on making music, or building websites, or writing fiction, or anything else, besides ‚Ä¶ regular life. I hate the normalcy, and my brain pushes back against it every second of the day. And I‚Äôm living two lives because of it. The person I am at work? Basically a visage that doesn‚Äôt really exist. A fake me that puts on this face that only exists for eight hours, five days a week. I‚Äôm so cut off between these two worlds that I just about completely refuse to interact with anyone I know within the building, outside of it.

But I‚Äôm rambling about these nonstop streams of thought, and I just wanted to express, mostly? That something needs to change. It‚Äôs been a while. And maybe I‚Äôve found some change in this little virtual reality space, VR Chat. But I need a bigger change. Whether that‚Äôs a web development career, or a solid, actual relationship, that doesn‚Äôt die out in months.

Heck, I dunno what it‚Äôs gonna be, but I know it‚Äôs coming.

Maybe I should write a resume for once?
